botanical_details.genus: Lilium are bulbous perennials with erect stems bearing whorled or spirally arranged leaves and terminal racemes or umbels of bowl-shaped, trumpet-shaped, funnel-shaped or turks cap shaped flowers, often fragrant, and white, yellow, orange or red

how_to_grow.cultivation: Plant bulbs in autumn, 15cm deep, in moist but well-drained soil enriched with leaf mould or well-rotted organic matter, ideally in full sun with the base of the plant in shade. See also growing lilies in containers for more information
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by division: detach offset bulblets when the leaves die down and plants become dormant
how_to_grow.pruning: Deadhead after flowering. Cut back stems when foliage dies down
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to lily beetle, aphids, slugs, snails, thrips, leatherjackets, and wireworms; plants in containers may be affected by vine weevil
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to grey moulds, various fungal infections and virus diseases. See lily diseases
